meanings.definition: Low in status or position compared to others.
meanings.sent1: The small house on the hill was much lowlier than the grand mansion in the city.
meanings.sent2: She felt lowlier than her classmates because she didn't have expensive clothes.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant thought the big elephant looked lowlier next to the majestic lion.
meanings.sent4: The dim candle seemed lowlier in brightness compared to the dazzling chandelier.
meanings.sent5: The old, rusty bike appeared even lowlier next to the shiny, new bicycles.

meanings.definition: Having less importance or value compared to others.
meanings.sent1: The plain rock seemed lowlier than the sparkling gem in the treasure chest.
meanings.sent2: Her lowlier position in the company made her feel unappreciated.
meanings.sent3: The wilted flower felt lowlier than the vibrant blooms in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The small pebble felt lowlier than the majestic mountain towering above.
meanings.sent5: The old, torn book appeared even lowlier next to the brand new bestseller.
